availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Oliver McReynolds (Todd County, Kentucky, physician)

body.p: Todd County, Kentucky, physician. Campbell County, Virginia, native. Son of James Campbell and Mary Bell McReynolds McReynolds. Married to Julia P. Gorin McReynolds in June 1853. Married to Ellen M. Reeves McReynolds in January 1859. Father of Mary B. McReynolds and James C. McReynolds. Attended the G. P. Street Academy in Christian County, Kentucky. Studied medicine under James A. McReynolds in 1846. Graduated from Jefferson Medical College in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, in 1849. Moved to Elkton, Kentucky. Physician in Elkton from 1849 to 1870. Owned twenty-four enslaved persons in Todd County in 1860.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Todd County, District No. 2, p. 4. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Todd County, Elkton, p. 71. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Todd County, Elkton, p. 34. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Todd County, Elkton, p. 71. Irving A Watson A. M., M. D., ed., Physicians and Surgeons of America: A Collection of Biographical Sketches of the Regular Medical Profession (Concord, New Hampshire: Republican Press Association, 1896), 39 - 40. Find A Grave, "Dr. John Oliver McReynolds (1827-1905)," Memorial #48332796, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/48332796/john-oliver-mcreynolds (accessed March 8, 2018).
